questions.instructions: Tick one box to show where the missing question mark should go.
questions.text: "How are you feeling today" asked the nurse.

questions.instructions: Put a tick in each row to show whether the sentence is a statement or a command.

left_items: Get the dustpan and brush, but be careful not to cut yourself.
At 4:30am, the intruder was arrested by six policemen.

questions.text: Underline the subordinate clause in each sentence below.
questions.passage: When she was standing next to her brother, Anita looked very tall. Even though he had little patience, Robert enjoyed chess. Sue’s skills were good although she had not been playing for long. They finished the walk, which seemed never-ending.

correct_words.word: When she was standing next to her brother
Even though he had little patience
although she had not been playing for long

questions.instruction: Transform the sentence into direct speech.

questions.text:
Circle the correct form of the verb in each set of brackets.

( creeps / creep ) The cheetah ________________ after its prey.
( produces / produce ) Skunks ________________ a very smelly spray that repels most predators.
( protects / protect ) The mother bear ________________ her young.
questions.instructions: Circle the correct form of the verb.
